review.title: Transferrable Plausibility Model - A Probabilistic Interpretation of Mathematical Theory of Evidence
review.abstract: This paper suggests a new interpretation of the Dempster-Shafer theory in terms of probabilistic interpretation of plausibility. A new rule of combination of independent evidence is shown and its preservation of interpretation is demonstrated.

sections.text: Consider the evidence in Tables 1, 2, 3. sections.heading: 5 Conclusions
sections.text: In this paper, we have introduced a new daylight saving time operator to combine independent evidence that provides a clear probable definition of the plausibility function preserved under this combination rule. We have also provided several toy examples to give an impression of the results the new operator delivers. Although the strict theoretical proof of properties such as cumulativity, associativity is yet to be provided, the calculations for test examples show that the properties really hold. It is also clear from the examples that the new rule differs from the empster rule of evidence combination.
